definition: to plunder the homes of the wealthy for food (in times of famine)/(of sb who has no income) to rely on others/to demand a "contribution" or "loan" from a business or wealthy individual
variant of 吃[chi1]
to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
a household/door/family
to eat without paying/to freeload
local bosses, shady gentry (idiom); dominant local mafia
local wealthy landlord/country money-bags/rich provincial
to break into a house for robbery (idiom)
landlord/landowner/host
rich family/large landlord
movable property/money and belongings/non-real estate assets
extortion by taking advantage of sb's weakness
true hero of Greenwood (refers to popular hero in Robin Hood style)
lumpenproletariat (in Marxist theory)
to kidnap (for ransom)
a large landowner
bandit
the benevolent man cannot be rich (idiom, from Mencius). It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of heaven (Matthew 19:24).
to rob the rich to help the poor (idiom)
to pool resources (for a gift, project etc)
